raw_output:
{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"Energy-integrating detectors", "p":"uses", "o":"phosphor", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"In indirect mode, the X-ray photons first pass through a layer of material called a phosphor, such as cesium iodide."},
    {"s":"Energy-integrating detectors", "p":"uses", "o":"photodiode", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"These visible photons then strike a photodiode layer, which converts the light into an electrical current."},
    {"s":"Energy-integrating detectors", "p":"uses", "o":"semiconductor material", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"In direct mode, there is no intermediate light conversion. Instead, the X-rays interact directly with a semiconductor material, such as amorphous selenium."},
    {"s":"Energy-integrating detectors", "p":"measures", "o":"total energy of all photons", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"the detector does not distinguish between high- and low-energy photons.

evidence: In direct mode, there is no intermediate light conversion. Instead, the X-rays interact directly with a semiconductor material, such as amorphous selenium.
